TEXT.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
TEXT.source: ['20. piramosen no kakawan a kanakan', '沒入岩石裡的小孩', 'The child who entered a rock', '', 'si apen Maveyvow (F, 58, Iranmilek)', '黃月娥，女，58，東清村', '']

S.FORM: no m-oli o ina na ori am, o ya o ai no pala da ori am, mi na panadeng-an ori a ma-nangdang a.
S.TRANSL: 每當他的母親從山上回來，總是看見他（孩子）貼靠著柴乾架烤火取暖
Every time the mother came back from the mountains, she saw her child leaning against the pillar of the heating rack to get warm.

S.FORM: “ka-pa-nangdang, mo koimo a, ji angay ma-ngayo a, ji angay ma-masil a, ji angay do i-yakan, manga anak ko, o maka-veyvow rana” koan na.
S.TRANSL: “孩子，你已經長大懂事了，怎麼還只會烤火取暖，不去撿木柴，也不去釣魚，也不去採集一些菜”
“Son, you are mature enough to know not to always be sitting there getting heat. Why don’t you go pick up firewood, go fishing, or pick plants to eat?”

S.FORM: to ma-nángdang ori, mang-dang-day so ara-raw o ka-ngay na ma-nangdang do a-emian ori, ta ji á-rekmeh no amian.
S.TRANSL: 每年冬天的時候，因為天氣冷，他就每天坐在火邊烤火取暖
Every winter, when the days were cold, he would sit everyday next to the fire to get warm.

S.FORM: m-ámo o anak na ori am, “to ko rana ngikáy-i si Ina saon” koan na am,
S.TRANSL: 他的小孩稍長，就想“我要對母親表示我的不滿”
The child was embarrassed (as he grew up), and thought, “I might as well show my mother how unhappy I am with her.”

S.FORM: to na rana angay mi-ttattaw do dang a, to na mi-ramós-i ori no wawa ori a,
S.TRANSL: 於是就去游泳了，讓海水淹溺他
He went to swim and took his life by drowning.

S.FORM: “imo rana kataotao ko am, to ka i mi-ávas jiaken a kakawan” koan na, to na? o kataotao na, pi-ramos-en no kakawan ori, to lida o kakawan ori a.
S.TRANSL: “礁石啊！你就經過（壓過）我的身體吧” ，不久，那礁石就慢慢的長大，然後把他夾起來了
“Reef, cover me up.” The reef slowly grew and covered him.

S.FORM: a ya ni-mi-ttattaw do attaw ya an, mi ta pala”, to sia angay sira miaven-do-vahay ya.
S.TRANSL: 會不會是去海邊游泳啊？我們去海邊找找看” ，他們夫妻倆就一起去找他
Maybe he has gone swimming. We have to go look.” The couple went out to look for him.

S.FORM: “o ito o oo na” koan na, am ovok na rana o ma-cita-cita da am, to da i nita am, to da a-kah-a o rako a kakawan do kataotao na?
S.TRANSL: 他說，“他的頭在那裡！” 但只看得到頭髮了。他們再靠過去看，試圖扒開黏在他身上的大礁石，但是哪裡扒得開？
“There he is,” the husband said, but they only saw his hair when they looked. How could they open the rock and break away his body from it?

S.FORM: am ori o kakawan do dang a, namen ngaran-an a asa ka ili a “do obo na Jiminapala” koan no nang ori a.
S.TRANSL: 因故，我們村就命名那礁石為“do obo na Jiminapala岩” （烘柴架的底下）
Therefore, our village named the place “ do obo na Jiminapala” (i.e., Under the heating rack).

S.FORM: ika-doa na no nang am, o líkey a k-anak-an am, “mo Ina,” koan na o ina na, “ikongo?”
S.TRANSL: 另外一個故事是這樣的。有一個小小孩，說“媽媽” ，母親說“什麼事？”
The second story is like this. There was a little child who said, “Mom.” “What is it?” the mother said.

S.FORM: “ya abo rana o yakan ta cinapay an?” “ásio pa, mo koimo”
S.TRANSL: “沒有芋頭葉菜了嗎？” ，“哪裡還有菜？”
“Are there any more taro leaves?” “How could there be [Impossible?”

S.FORM: “taon a, nio rana ji manta-n yaken do cinapay, ta inio mi-yakan” koan na no kanakan a,
S.TRANSL: “你們怎麼不留一點給我？難道就只有你們可以吃芋頭葉菜嗎” 小孩子說
“You ate them all and didn’t leave any for me? Are you the only ones who can eat them?” the child said.

S.FORM: “sáon jimo am”, to rana abo o k-anak-an ori a.
S.TRANSL: “隨便你啦” 。之後小孩子就不見了
“It’s your own fault.” The child disappeared.

S.FORM: m-ównay am, “a ya pa ji ngoli a, ya ni-ma-ngay jino si koa, a ya ni-ma-ngay do wajin ori?”.
S.TRANSL: 過了很久，“怎麼還不回來，孩子去哪裡了？他去什麼地方呢？”
After a long time, they said, “Where is the child? Why hasn’t he come back yet? Where did he go?”

S.FORM: mi da cita-en am, akman so sang a, oo na o ma-cita da,
S.TRANSL: 他們去看（找）的時候，如同前述的故事情形一樣，也只看見他的頭了
When they went to look, the same thing happened to the boy as in the previous story. Only the head was visible.

S.FORM: “a o ito si alikey a, mi ta pala hap-en”, to da i nga-hap-a am, to da a-hap o ito rana o ma-cita da do kakawan, a ni-d-om-ket do kakawan.
S.TRANSL: “孩子在那裡！我們去看看！” 他們過去一看，結果他已黏在礁石上了，能看見的就只有這麼一點了（用手比），怎麼拉得起來？”

“There is the child. Let’s go see.” When they went to look, they could only see this much [action. They tried to pull him out, but he was already stuck in the reef, so it was impossible to pull him out.

S.FORM: am mi-da-dowdaw rana sira a om-lavi am, ori o kava-kavavatanen no inapo ta,
S.TRANSL: 於是他們很傷心的哭了。這就是我們祖先的故事
They cried over losing their child. This is a story of our ancestors.

S.FORM: a ci-cilo-an ko si ama icalaw a, na kavos-an no nang, manga wari an.
S.TRANSL: 以上是從我父親那裡聽來的，故事就講到這裡結束，各位。
This is something that I heard from my father. This is the end.

S.FORM: toda a-ónay am, toda á-hep am, “a ya ni-mi do wajin, ya pa ji ngoli si alikey ya?
S.TRANSL: 過了很久，而且愈來愈晚了，“孩子去哪裡了？怎麼還不回家？
After a long time, when it was already night time, the Mother thought,“Where is my boy? Why isn’t he home yet?”

S.FORM: “a k-óm-oan, manga anak ko am, a ya ji a-líkey ori”.
S.TRANSL: “沒辦法，菜就那麼一點點啊”
“We had no choice. There was very little.”

S.FORM: ko ji a-tenng-i, manga wari o ka mehakay na ka mavakes na no nang no ni-m-indok ori a, ala mehakay ori, ni-m-indok do cinapay.
S.TRANSL: 各位，我（口述者）不知道那個因為不滿父母的小孩，是男還是女；那個沒吃到芋頭葉而不滿父母的小孩可能是男的吧
I [speaker don’t know if the child was a girl or a boy who was upset because [there were no taro leaves. It probably was a boy.
